post.author: Pavitr Prabhakar
post.title: Bollywood to Billboards: How Indian Celebrities Add Spice to Advertising
post.text:
Hello, advertising aficionados! Have you ever wondered why Indian advertisements feel like mini Bollywood movies? Well, it’s not just your imagination— Indian celebrities and advertising go together like chai and biscuits. It’s an open secret that in India, celebrity endorsements are not just a tactic but an entire strategy wrapped in glam and glitz. Here’s the lowdown on how these stars light up the world of Indian commercials. Grab your popcorn, and let’s unravel this star-studded drama! 



Flashy, Sassy and Oh So Classy!



First thing’s first: charisma. When these celebs waltz onto your TV screen with their designer clothes and million-dollar smiles, it’s hard not to drop what you’re doing and take notice. They’ve got charm and they’re not afraid to use it! Using Indian celebrity ads is like the marketing equivalent of a masala movie—it has all the right ingredients to catch your attention and leave you craving for more. 



Relatability Meets Royalty



It’s a peculiar affair, really. Even though these celebrities live lives that are miles away from the average Indian, advertisers masterfully weave narratives that position these stars in everyday scenarios. Picture this: a famous actress arguing over the perfect spice level in her sambar, or a leading cricketer facing the terror of a washing machine. Suddenly, they’re not just stars—they are people just like us (but with better hair)! 



The Ripple Effect of Star Power



When a big name from the silver screen pitches a product, it doesn’t just stay within the confines of those who tune in; it becomes a household discussion topic. From chai-time gossip to office water-cooler chat, everyone’s got an opinion on the latest ad. The effectiveness of celebrity endorsements can be debated, but their ability to start conversations? Absolutely not! 



A Spoonful of Stardom



Using celebrities in ads is also a sneaky way for brands to add a spoonful of stardom to their products. Think about it—would you not feel just a tiny bit more fabulous using the same face cream as the heartthrob of the nation? It’s not just advertising; it’s like a fairy dust sprinkle of glamour onto mundane daily goods. 



The Twist in the Plot



But here comes the twist – not all that glitters in Indian celebrity ads is gold. Consumers are becoming savvier, and there’s a growing demand for authenticity and real connections. Brands now face the challenge of not just grabbing attention with star power but also crafting compelling stories that resonate and create genuine engagement. 



Wrap Up with A Dance Number



In conclusion, much like any Bollywood blockbuster that ends with a dance number, Indian celebrities in advertisements leave a memorable imprint. They bring the flair, the drama, and the emotions, turning bland commercials into buzz-worthy spectacles. Will this trend continue? As long as there are stories to tell and stars to showcase, the sage of glitzy endorsements is far from over. 



So, next time you see a commercial break rolling on your screen, watch out for the stars. Not up above, but right there—dancing, laughing, and selling, all in that charismatic Bollywood style!

post.author: Akanksha
post.title: Sheena Chohan Accepts Award from US President Biden – Calls for Mandatory Human Rights Education in India
post.text:
Actress Sheena Chohan was given The President’s Lifetime Achievement Award from the President of the United States, Joseph Biden, at a ceremony on 8th June in the USA – she used her speech to call for all Indian schools and universities to teach human rights in a practical way, so people understand and can benefit from the Indian Constitution. 
☝️Photo – Sheena Chohan with the President’s Lifetime Achievement Award – signed by US President Biden 
Because Sheena Chohan comes up number one on Google if you search “Indian Actor Human Rights”, she was personally asked by the United Nations Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights, Volker Türk, to help promote the 75th anniversary of the Universal Declaration on Human Rights. Sheena is the only Indian celebrity followed by Volker Türk’s official office on Instagram (instagram.com/unitednationshumanrights). 
Sheena took High Commissioner Türk’s request to heart and received the award from President Biden for spreading awareness of basic rights and equality to over 170 million people. 
Sheena said: “Human Rights are the way to create a decent society of peace and equality and the most important way to achieve that is through awareness and education campaigns. My podcast, Born Free & Equal, which teamed up with artists like Preety Zinta, Sonakshi Sinha, Raveena Tandon, Sonu Sood, Sanjana Sanghi, Imtiaz Ali and more, spread awareness of basic rights and equality to over a hundred million people during lockdown, but it’s nowhere near enough! India is the most populous and youthful country in the world – we need our youth to completely understand their rights, and in a way that’s in line with the excellent new National Education Policy. Our rights must be taught so they are understood – which means looking up the hard to understand words in a dictionary and giving real life examples so children and young people actually understand what No Discrimination or the other rights like Social Security, No Torture, No Slavery, etc., mean.” 
Sheena was previously given the Human Rights Hero Award at the United Nations in New York, partly for her work getting human rights education into the curriculums of over 100 schools and universities. She continued: 
“United for Human Rights (www.humanrights.com) has made each of the 30 human rights into Hollywood quality films and dubbed them in Hindi and gives free education kits to any school or university in the world. India has one of the finest constitutions on the planet – it contains all of the rights and responsibilities that the laws of our land are based on. It’s the most important information that all citizens must know – so it must become mandatory in all Indian schools and universities!” 
On the work front Sheena is in America shooting, while she waits for her Hollywood launch in a film directed by Taron Lexton which tied the Guinness Book of World Records for the film shot in the most countries. Last week Sheena’s Hindi film Amar Prem was launched in the official Indian pavilion at the world’s most prestigious film festival – Cannes. 
Sheena returns to India in mid-June to finish shooting for a web-series where she plays a negative lead and the launch of her Hindi debut – Sant Tukaram , where she plays the lead female role alongside Subodh Bhave in Aditya Om’s Hindi Historical Drama – Sant Tukaram. 
Sheena was last seen on Netflix’s Fame Game, alongside Madhuri Dixit, Disney Hot Star’s The Trial alongside Kajol and she was nominated for Best Actress for her lead role in Ant Story, which was bought by Netflix. 
The post Sheena Chohan Accepts Award from US President Biden – Calls for Mandatory Human Rights Education in India appeared first on Bollywood Couch.

post.author: Priya Prakash
post.title: From Naked To Akind, 13 Indian Celebrity-Owned Beauty Brands
post.text:
Skincare and beauty play a pivotal role in the glamour of showbiz. Celebrities invest significant time in elaborate makeup and hairstyles daily, prompting many prominent figures to explore the business side of beauty. Here are 13 Indian celebrity-owned beauty brands that have swiftly garnered attention and acclaim, making waves in the industry. 
Indian Celebrity-Owned Beauty Brands
Lisa Haydon, Naked
Lisa Haydon ventured into the beauty industry with her skincare line, Naked, in 2013. The products in this line are handcrafted, organic, and free from preservatives, offering consumers a natural and luxurious skincare experience. 
Sunny Leone, Startstruck by SL
Sunny Leone entered the beauty market by launching her fragrance line in 2017, followed by Startstruck by SL in 2018, offering affordable makeup options. Her range is allegedly entirely vegan and cruelty-free, tailored to complement Indian skin tones and complexions. 
Lara Dutta, Arias
Lara Dutta embarked on her beauty journey with the launch of Arias in 2018, offering skincare and fragrances. Drawing inspiration from her own experiences, from her beauty pageant days to motherhood, Dutta credits her diverse journey for shaping the brand, focusing on skincare and ageing gracefully. 
Katrina Kaif, Kay Beauty
Katrina Kaif ventured into the beauty industry with the launch of her makeup brand, Kay Beauty, in 2019. Since its inception, the brand has quickly gained popularity and is now recognised as one of India's leading cosmetic lines. Embracing the tagline "It's 'Kay to be You," Kay Beauty resonates with women by offering a range of affordable yet high-quality makeup products. 












View this post on Instagram























A post shared by Kay Beauty By Katrina (@kaybykatrina) 




 
Anusha Dandekar, Brown Skin Beauty
Amidst the pandemic, Anusha Dandekar introduced Brown Skin Beauty, a skincare line specifically formulated for brown skin. This collection emphasises the use of natural ingredients to enhance the skin's glow while being eco-friendly, cruelty-free, and locally produced in India, aligning with clean and sustainable beauty standards. 












View this post on Instagram























A post shared by BrownSkin Beauty (@brownskinbeautyofficial) 




 
Kavita Kaushik- Aparna Auntys
Kavita Kaushik launched a line of natural Ayurvedic formulas under the brand Aparna Auntys in 2022. These products aim to benefit users in their skincare and hair care routines. Developed from seeds, flowers, vegetable extracts, plant juices, herbs, roots, minerals, vitamins, and essential oils, these formulas are entirely natural and free from chemicals, preservatives, added colours, or any toxic ingredients. 












View this post on Instagram























A post shared by Kavita Kaushik (@ikavitakaushik) 




 
Masaba Gupta, Love Child
Masaba Gupta, a renowned fashion designer in India, ventured into the beauty industry with her makeup brand called LoveChild in 2022. This brand offers a variety of products, including perfumes, nail lacquers, and lip colours, tailored to suit Indian skin types and tones. 












View this post on Instagram























A post shared by LoveChild by Masaba (@lovechildbymasaba) 




 
Priyanka Chopra, Anamoly
The popularity of Priyanka Chopra's Anamoly has grown since its release in India and the USA in 2022. The hair care label is committed to delivering affordable, best-in-class products, believing everyone should have access to high-quality hair care solutions. 












View this post on Instagram























A post shared by Anomaly Haircare (@anomalyhaircare) 




 
Deepika Padukone, 82 Degrees East
Deepika Padukone introduced her beauty brand, 82 Degrees East, in 2022. This brand features beauty and skincare products such as moisturisers and oil-based sunscreens. 82 Degrees East focuses on holistic practices aimed at nourishing the mind, body, and spirit through self-care. 












View this post on Instagram























A post shared by दीपिका पादुकोण (@deepikapadukone) 




 
Sonakshi Sinha, Soezi
Sonakshi Sinha introduced a beauty brand focused on nail care called Soezi in 2022. The brand offers press-on nails with easy-to-apply kits available in vibrant colours and shades. Soezi aims to simplify nail care, allowing customers to maintain neatly manicured nails effortlessly. 












View this post on Instagram























A post shared by Sonakshi Sinha (@aslisona) 




 
Kriti Sanon, Hyphen
Kriti Sanon ventured into the beauty industry with her brand called Hyphen in 2023. This line offers a wide range of skincare products, including sunscreens, moisturisers, serums, and more. Hyphen prides itself on harnessing the power of nature, with all products being vegan-free, plastic-free, and 100% natural, according to their website. 












View this post on Instagram























A post shared by Kriti (@kritisanon) 




 
Nayanthara, 9 Skins
Nayanthara in 2023 launched her beauty brand, 9 Skin, with a focus on self-love and clean ingredients. The brand's products are formulated with natural and modern science-backed ingredients, designed to elevate one's self-care routine and promote healthier, glowing skin. 












View this post on Instagram























A post shared by 9 S K I N • S K I N C A R E (@9skinofficial) 




 
Mira Rajput Kapoor, Akind
Mira Rajput Kapoor has now joined the ranks of celebrity-owned beauty brands with her brand, Akind. Described as a barrier-focused skincare line, Akind aims to provide care and bliss to individuals with unique skin types. The brand emphasises the importance of self-care, mirroring the belief that every individual's skin deserves personalised attention and care. 












View this post on Instagram























A post shared by Mira Rajput Kapoor (@mira.kapoor) 




 
Have you had the chance to try any of these brands, and if so, what was your experience like?

post.title: Travis Kelce missed all of Taylor Swift’s Eras Tour shows in Edinburgh
post.text: Travis Kelce missed Taylor Swift’s Eras Tour concerts in Edinburgh, choosing to stay in the U.S. and participate in a celebrity softball game in Ohio.Kelce hit 11 home runs and won the home run derby trophy at the David Njoku Celebrity Softball Game.The couple last vacationed in Lake Como, Italy, and may reunite in France or London during Swift’s tour break.Travis Kelce was notably absent from Taylor Swift’s recent Eras Tour concerts in Edinburgh, Scotland. Instead, he opted to participate in the David Njoku Celebrity Softball Game in Eastlake, Ohio, where he showcased his athletic skills by hitting 11 home runs and winning the home run derby trophy. The couple last spent time together in Europe during a romantic getaway in Lake Como, Italy, following Swift’s final Paris show. With Kelce scheduled to record a podcast in Cannes on June 20, there’s a chance they could reunite either in France or London, where Swift’s next Eras Tour show is set for June 21. Taylor Swift’s Edinburgh Shows Are Not For Travis KelceTravis Kelce was absent from Taylor Swift’s three Eras Tour shows in Edinburgh, Scotland. Instead, he stayed in the United States to participate in the David Njoku Celebrity Softball Game in Eastlake, Ohio. At the softball game, Kelce excelled, hitting 11 home runs and winning the event’s home run derby trophy. His performance was highlighted by Cleveland’s News 5, showcasing his athletic prowess off the football field. Kelce last attended Swift’s concert in Paris on May 12, after which the couple enjoyed a romantic vacation in Lake Como, Italy. They were spotted having candlelit dinners and sharing a kiss during a boat ride, capturing the attention of fans and paparazzi alike. With Kelce scheduled to be in Cannes on June 20 for a podcast recording, there is a possibility of a reunion. Swift has a break in her tour, giving them a chance to meet in France or for Kelce to join her in London on June 21 for her next concert. Looking ahead, the couple’s busy schedules still offer a glimmer of hope for a reunion. With Kelce’s upcoming podcast recording in Cannes on June 20 and Swift’s tour break aligning, fans eagerly anticipate whether they will reunite in France or in London for Swift’s next performance on June 21. post.author: Rohan Hemnani
post.title: The Future of Content Marketing: AI-Powered Strategies for Success
post.text: How Artificial Intelligence is Revolutionizing Content MarketingThis is an AI-generated image from BingIn the dynamic realm of digital marketing, content remains king. Nevertheless, the manner in which content gets produced, optimized, and evaluated has experienced a noteworthy shift with the arrival of Artificial Intelligence (AI). AI-driven content marketing represents more than just a catchphrase, and it’s a game-changer. This article will go through the various facets of AI within content marketing, comprising ideation, generation, optimization, and analysis. We’ll delve into practical instances, dissect the results, and gauge the impact on revenue and engagement. Additionally, we’ll tackle the hurdles of AI-empowered content marketing and wrap up with some perspectives on the potential it holds for the future of marketing. Why use AI in digital marketing?AI in digital marketing can be used in various content creation stages, Let’s see each stage and how they make content better. Why use AI in digital marketing? 8 points are mentionedPersonalization: AI has the capability to analyze extensive volumes of data, including customer demographics, internet history, and buying patterns, in order to comprehend individual preferences and actions. This empowers marketers to craft highly customized content that connects with their target audience. For instance, AI can assess a customer’s previous purchases and internet activity to suggest products or services that match their interests.Content Distribution: AI can analyze audience behavior to determine the best time to distribute content. For example, AI can analyze when customers are most active on social media and schedule posts accordingly. This increases the reach and effectiveness of the content.Efficiency: AI powered tools have the capability to automate repetitive tasks like the creation, distribution, and analysis of content. For instance, AI has the ability to automatically produce personalized email campaigns, schedule social media posts, and analyze content performance. This allows marketers to concentrate on strategy and creativity rather than wasting time on manual assignments.Predictive Analytics: AI’s ability to examine data and forecast upcoming trends and customer actions is crucial in modern marketing strategies. By examining historical sales data and customer interactions, AI can predict the future popularity of certain products or services. This empowers marketers to base their decisions on solid data insights, enabling them to outshine their rivals.Content Analysis: AI can analyze content to identify trends, sentiment, and topics of interest. For example, AI can analyze social media conversations to identify trending topics or customer sentiment. This helps marketers understand their audience and create more relevant content.SEO: AI can analyze search engine algorithms and user behavior to optimize content for search engines. For example, AI can analyze which keywords are most effective at driving traffic and conversions, and optimize content accordingly. This increases the visibility and ranking of the content.Content Optimization: AI can analyze content performance and offer insights for enhancement. For instance, AI is efficient in assessing the most effective headlines, keywords, and calls-to-action that drive engagement and conversions. This helps marketers optimize their content to increase its effectiveness.Content Creation: AI can generate content based on data and trends. For example, AI can analyze customer reviews and feedback to generate product titles and descriptions or blog posts. This saves time and resources, as marketers don’t have to create content from scratch.Overall, AI can help marketers create more personalized, efficient, and effective content that resonates with their audience and drives results, let's see some AI tools used in each content creation stage Content IdeationContent ideation involves generating relevant and engaging content ideas that resonate with your target audience. Tools like BuzzSumo leverage AI to identify trending topics and high-performing content, providing insights for strategic content creation. SEMrush offers robust keyword analysis features to uncover valuable keywords and track performance, while Keyword Insights uses AI for keyword clustering and idea generation, making content optimization more efficient. Let’s discover how each tool can be useful for content ideation. BuzzSumo: BuzzSumo, powered by AI, identifies trending topics and content by analyzing vast online data, helping you find resonating content ideas. It offers insights into top-performing content, aiding in tailoring your strategy. It also compares your content performance to competitors, revealing areas for improvement. In essence, BuzzSumo’s AI acts as a research assistant, empowering data-driven decisions and higher success chances.SEMrush: SEMrush’s Keyword Research Tool offers a suite of features for comprehensive keyword analysis. It provides insights into keyword performance, competition, and related keywords. Users can identify long-tail keywords, compare their site’s performance with competitors, and track keyword rankings over time. The tool also offers data on CPC, search volume, and keyword difficulty, allowing for informed decision-making in digital marketing strategies.Keyword insights: Keyword Insights allows you to generate thousands of keyword ideas, group them into topical clusters and create or optimize existing content effortlessly using AI. It helps you to create content ideas based on your keywords with their built-in feature with Keyword clustering and keyword discovery.Content CreationContent creation involves producing engaging and high-quality content for various platforms. Synthesia uses AI to create avatars for videos, offering speech in over 130 languages with perfect lip-syncing. ChatGPT by OpenAI generates and optimizes text for articles, blogs, and social media, aiding in idea generation and writer’s block. Jasper.ai enhances content creation by analyzing inputs to produce content that matches your brand’s voice and style, offering templates and creative prompts to streamline the process. Let’s find out how each AI tool can support us in content creation. Synthesia: Synthesia is an AI tools which can create an AI avatar for your video and you can let that avatar speak in 130+ languages with perfectly lip sync voice. We can also create our own Digital avatar and clone our voice for the videos.ChatGPT: ChatGPT, an AI model by OpenAI, is a versatile tool for content creation. It can generate text for various platforms like articles, blog posts, and social media. It aids writers by overcoming writer’s block, generating ideas, and even drafting entire pieces of content. Additionally, it optimizes existing content by suggesting improvements, personalized content based on user input, and curates content by summarizing articles or generating content based on keywords or topics. This makes it an invaluable asset for content creators, enhancing efficiency and quality.Jasper.ai: Jasper.ai leverages AI to supercharge content creation. It analyzes your input and brand voice to craft content that aligns with your needs and style. From pre-built templates to AI-generated art, Jasper streamlines the process while offering creative prompts to overcome writer’s block.Content OptimizationContent optimization involves refining content to improve its performance and engagement. MarketMuse uses AI to analyze existing content, suggest SEO improvements, and identify content gaps. Surfer SEO optimizes content based on real-time data, focusing on factors like keyword usage, content length, and readability. Adobe Target uses AI for A/B testing, determining which content variations yield the best results in terms of conversions and engagement. Let’s understand how each tool can facilitate our efforts in content optimization. MarketMuse: AI-powered content intelligence platform that analyzes existing content, suggests improvements for SEO and audience engagement, and identifies content gaps.Surfer SEO: AI writing assistant that analyzes content based on real-time data to optimize for SEO factors like keyword usage, content length, and readability.Adobe Target: Adobe Target facilitates A/B testing, a technique where different variations of content are displayed to different user groups. AI analyzes the results, identifying the content variations that perform best based on pre-defined goals like conversions or engagement.Content AnalysisContent analysis involves examining and interpreting data to improve content strategy. Adobe Analytics leverages AI to detect data anomalies, uncover trends, and use predictive analytics for forecasting, aiding in decision-making and marketing optimization. Sprout Social provides insights into consumer behavior and market trends, demonstrating the ROI of social media efforts and guiding strategic use of social platforms to enhance business outcomes. Let’s look into how each tool can help us with content analysis. Adobe Analytics: Adobe Analytics empowers users with the power of AI through its Adobe Sensei framework. This goes beyond just presenting data. AI in Adobe Analytics helps in several ways, it automatically detects anomalies in data, uncovering hidden trends and potential issues. It also uses predictive analytics to forecast future trends and customer actions, enabling informed decision-making and marketing optimization. Furthermore, AI assists in attribution modeling, pinpointing the influence of different marketing touchpoints on conversions, leading to efficient budget allocation and campaign improvement.Sprout Social: Sprout’s analytics tools unlock profound insights for understanding your consumers, recognizing market trends, and demonstrating the ROI of your social impact. This helps your organization strategically utilize social platforms to enhance future business outcomes.Cadbury’s Covid-19 Case StudyThe COVID-19 pandemic had a significant impact on global economies, especially affecting small local businesses in India. These businesses found it difficult to sell their products and services and make a profit. However, during Diwali, Mondelēz International wanted to help these local Indian shopkeepers. They created an innovative AI avatar campaign featuring Shah Rukh Khan, a popular Indian celebrity. Cadbury celebration “Notjustacadburyad” Campaign screenshot with Shahrukh KhanOgilvy, a creative agency, made ads for small stores that featured Shah Rukh Khan, encouraging people to support local businesses during Diwali. The AI-powered tool used for these ads was impressive, as it could create over 2,000 personalized advertisements for various types of stores across the country. Wavemaker, along with Google and YouTube, worked on a media plan to make sure the ads reached the right audience and engaged them effectively. The ads were targeted to consumers based on their location, promoting nearby small businesses. Since it was impossible to cover all the stores in the country, the team came up with a smart solution. They created a microsite where small business owners could make their own ads, featuring Shah Rukh Khan and their store names. These ads could then be easily shared on social media and other platforms. The campaign was a huge success. A total of 130,000 ads were created, featuring 2,000 stores, and they received an impressive 94 million views on YouTube and Facebook. This campaign not only showed the effectiveness of AI in marketing but also highlighted how it can help local businesses, especially during tough times. OutcomeAccording to rephrase.ai, The campaign contributed to a remarkable 29% growth in Cadbury Celebrations’ sales during Diwali, marking the brand’s highest-ever Diwali performance. The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) reported a remarkable 74% increase in Diwali sales, achieving the highest sales in a decade. This surge can be attributed to the campaign’s positive influence on consumer purchasing behavior and support for local businesses. Cyber Inc Case StudyCyber Inc. aimed to expand its business operations and venture into new markets, encountering a major obstacle in producing training videos. https://medium.com/media/37f2b233509eb348c6c2d960ce489a63/hrefChallenges Time-Consuming: The conventional method of hiring and briefing actors consumed significant time.Costly: Given the team’s lack of video production expertise, outsourcing to third-party providers incurred hefty expenses, averaging at $3,000 per minute of finished video.Not flexible: Shooting traditional video makes it difficult to edit a video and often requires starting from scratch.Localization: Crafting videos in multiple languages posed challenges in terms of time, expense, and scalability.Alain Rees, the Director of Cyber Inc., and his team sought innovative solutions beyond conventional video production methods and stumbled upon Synthesia. With Synthesia, Cyber Inc. can now effortlessly extend its training programs into various markets. How do they achieve this? Initially, Alain’s team crafts a personalized avatar using Synthesia.Next, they develop pertinent training scripts and translate them into six different languages.Once the scripts are finalized, they seamlessly integrate the respective language versions into Synthesia’s script interface.Lastly, they enhance the video with backgrounds, animations, and screen recordings.And voilà! The video is all set for deployment! OutcomeAccording to synthesia.io, Cyber Inc. harnessed Synthesia’s innovative platform to accelerate video production by 2x, while seamlessly localizing content into six languages. Witness how they effortlessly penetrated new markets and regions with dynamic training materials. AI ChallengesWhile AI offers numerous benefits for content marketing, there are also several challenges that need to be addressed: Data Quality and Quantity: AI algorithms need plentiful high-quality data to operate effectively. Ensuring that the data utilized to train AI models are precise, essential, and reflective of the intended audience can pose a significant hurdle.Algorithm Bias: AI algorithms can be biased if they are trained on biased data. This can lead to unfair or discriminatory outcomes, which can damage a brand’s reputation and lead to legal and ethical issues.Complexity and Cost: Implementing AI in content marketing requires expertise in AI technologies, which can be complex and costly. Small businesses and organizations with limited resources may struggle to adopt AI effectively.Lack of Transparency: AI algorithms can be opaque, making it difficult to understand how they arrive at their decisions. This lack of transparency can make it challenging to identify and address biases and errors.Ethical Considerations: AI-powered content marketing raises ethical questions, such as the use of personal data and the potential for manipulation. Ensuring that AI-powered content marketing is used ethically and responsibly is essential for maintaining trust and credibility.ConclusionAI in content marketing is a game-changer, making content more personalized and engaging. It analyzes data to understand audience preferences, leading to higher engagement and conversion rates. However, it’s important to use AI responsibly, with human oversight and integration into existing workflows. Experimentation and tracking results are key to finding the best tools for your needs. AI has the potential to greatly improve marketing effectiveness, giving businesses a competitive edge in the digital landscape. In conclusion, AI’s application in content marketing presents the opportunity for a significant enhancement in marketing effectiveness. This enhancement will result in increased brand recognition, increased customer interaction, and better conversion rates. Enterprises that adopt these technological advancements will gain a competitive edge in the constantly evolving digital terrain. The Future of Content Marketing: AI-Powered Strategies for Success was originally published in Globant on Medium, where people are continuing the conversation by highlighting and responding to this story.

post.title: Sheena Chohan Accepts Award from US President Biden - Calls for Mandatory Human Rights Education in India
post.text: Actress Sheena Chohan was given The President’s Lifetime Achievement Award from the President of the United States, Joseph Biden, at a ceremony on 8th June in the USA - she used her speech to call for all Indian schools and universities to teach human rights in a practical way, so people understand and can benefit from the Indian Constitution.                                     ☝️Photo – Sheena Chohan with the President’s Lifetime Achievement Award – signed by US President Biden Because Sheena Chohan comes up number one on Google if you search “Indian Actor Human Rights”, she was personally asked by the United Nations Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights, Volker Türk, to help promote the 75th anniversary of the Universal Declaration on Human Rights. Sheena is the only Indian celebrity followed by Volker Türk’s official office on Instagram (instagram.com/unitednationshumanrights). Sheena took High Commissioner Türk’s request to heart and received the award from President Biden for spreading awareness of basic rights and equality to over 170 million people.  Sheena said: “Human Rights are the way to create a decent society of peace and equality and the most important way to achieve that is through awareness and education campaigns. My podcast, Born Free & Equal, which teamed up with artists like Preety Zinta, Sonakshi Sinha, Raveena Tandon, Sonu Sood, Sanjana Sanghi, Imtiaz Ali and more, spread awareness of basic rights and equality to over a hundred million people during lockdown, but it’s nowhere near enough! India is the most populous and youthful country in the world – we need our youth to completely understand their rights, and in a way that’s in line with the excellent new National Education Policy. Our rights must be taught so they are understood – which means looking up the hard to understand words in a dictionary and giving real life examples so children and young people actually understand what No Discrimination or the other rights like Social Security, No Torture, No Slavery, etc., mean.”  Sheena was previously given the Human Rights Hero Award at the United Nations in New York, partly for her work getting human rights education into the curriculums of over 100 schools and universities. She continued: “United for Human Rights (www.humanrights.com) has made each of the 30 human rights into Hollywood quality films and dubbed them in Hindi and gives free education kits to any school or university in the world. India has one of the finest constitutions on the planet - it contains all of the rights and responsibilities that the laws of our land are based on. It’s the most important information that all citizens must know – so it must become mandatory in all Indian schools and universities!” On the work front Sheena is in America shooting, while she waits for her Hollywood launch in a film directed by Taron Lexton which tied the Guinness Book of World Records for the film shot in the most countries. Last week Sheena’s Hindi film Amar Prem was launched in the official Indian pavilion at the world’s most prestigious film festival – Cannes. Sheena returns to India in mid-June to finish shooting for a web-series where she plays a negative lead and the launch of her Hindi debut – Sant Tukaram , where she plays the lead female role alongside Subodh Bhave in Aditya Om’s Hindi Historical Drama – Sant Tukaram. Sheena was last seen on Netflix’s Fame Game, alongside Madhuri Dixit, Disney Hot Star’s The Trial alongside Kajol and she was nominated for Best Actress for her lead role in Ant Story, which was bought by Netflix.
